intro: Lycianthes quichensis, commonly known as the Quiché bitterleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and oval-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, yellowish flowers that give way to berries containing several seeds. Lycianthes quichensis is often found in moist, tropical habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
